segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And if you've been listening to our recent lessons, you know that we've been talking a lot about food.
segments.cn: 如果你们听了我们最近的课程，你们知道我们谈了很多关于食物的话题。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And today we have another lesson all about food from a different country.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节关于来自不同国家的食物的课程。

segments.en: Last time we took a look at Mexican food, Chinese food.
segments.cn: 上次我们看了墨西哥食物和中国食物。

segments.en: Now we are talking about Indian food.
segments.cn: 现在我们要谈的是印度食物。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Indian food is very famous for being spicy, but not all of it is spicy.
segments.cn: 印度食物以辛辣著称，但并不是所有的食物都辣。

segments.en: Let's.
segments.cn: 让我们开始吧。

segments.en: So where is this mystery restaurant that we're going to?
segments.cn: 那我们要去的神秘餐厅在哪里？

segments.en: It's an Indian restaurant.
segments.cn: 是一家印度餐厅。

segments.en: I know you have never had Indian food, so I thought you might want to try it.
segments.cn: 我知道你从未吃过印度食物，所以我想你可能想尝试一下。

segments.en: That sounds great.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: I am craving some type of beef dish.
segments.cn: 我想吃某种牛肉菜肴。

segments.en: Well, Indian cuisine actually doesn't serve beef.
segments.cn: 其实，印度菜不提供牛肉。

segments.en: You see, cows are a sacred animal, a very important element in the Hindu religion, so beef is not eaten.
segments.cn: 你看，牛是神圣的动物，在印度教中非常重要，所以不吃牛肉。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: So what are we having?
segments.cn: 那我们吃什么？

segments.en: Chicken?
segments.cn: 鸡肉？

segments.en: There are many amazing dishes to choose from.
segments.cn: 有很多美味的菜肴可供选择。

segments.en: We can have some chicken chikka masala, which is an amazing curry.
segments.cn: 我们可以吃一些鸡肉咖喱，这是一道很棒的咖喱。

segments.en: It's a bit spicy, but I think you can handle it.
segments.cn: 有点辣，但我觉得你能接受。

segments.en: Sounds good.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: I've always heard that Indian spices give a rich flavor to food.
segments.cn: 我一直听说印度香料给食物带来丰富的味道。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Also, we can have some naan bread, which is baked in a tandoori oven.
segments.cn: 另外，我们可以吃一些烤饼，这是在坦杜里烤箱中烤制的。

segments.en: Since you don't use any utensils to eat, you can use this bread to scoop up the curry or rice.
segments.cn: 由于你不使用任何餐具来吃饭，你可以用这块面包来舀咖喱或米饭。

segments.en: What about veggies?
segments.cn: 蔬菜呢？

segments.en: Oh, they have a good variety of vegetable-based dishes like palak paneer, vegetable samosas, or dal.
segments.cn: 哦，他们有很多美味的蔬菜菜肴，比如菠菜奶酪、蔬菜萨莫萨或达尔。

segments.en: It all sounds so exquisite.
segments.cn: 听起来都很美味。

segments.en: I can't wait.
segments.cn: 我等不及了。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at a couple of words and phrases here on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看这里的几个单词和短语，关于语言学习。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言学习。

segments.en: So in this first Language Takeaway today, we have words that are about the kinds of food we're eating today.
segments.cn: 在今天的第一个语言学习中，我们有关于我们今天吃的食物种类的单词。

segments.en: So the first one, the character said, I am craving some type of beef.
segments.cn: 第一个，角色说，我想吃某种牛肉。

segments.en: So to crave something.
segments.cn: 所以想吃某样东西。

segments.en: Okay, so that is a verb, to crave.
segments.cn: 好的，这个动词是想吃。

segments.en: And that means that you have a desire, you really want to eat something, to have a particular thing.
segments.cn: 这意味着你有一种渴望，你真的想吃某样东西，想要某种特定的东西。

segments.en: That's right, but it's particular, so it's something specific.
segments.cn: 没错，但它是特定的，所以是某种具体的东西。

segments.en: For example, pregnant women are famous for craving strange foods like pickles.
segments.cn: 例如，孕妇以渴望奇怪的食物如腌黄瓜而闻名。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，正是如此。

segments.en: So if you say I'm craving some ice cream, you specifically want ice cream or maybe vanilla ice cream.
segments.cn: 所以如果你说我想吃冰淇淋，你特别想要冰淇淋，或者可能是香草冰淇淋。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正确。

segments.en: And this person wants beef, but unfortunately there is no beef at Indian restaurants because cows are what?
segments.cn: 而这个人想吃牛肉，但不幸的是，印度餐厅没有牛肉，因为牛是什么？

segments.en: Cows are a sacred animal, so they are sacred in India.
segments.cn: 牛是神圣的动物，所以在印度是神圣的。

segments.en: Sacred means special or somehow important in a religious way.
segments.cn: 神圣意味着在宗教上特殊或重要。

segments.en: For example, it could say this is a very sacred place, so please don't use cameras or phones and take your shoes off.
segments.cn: 例如，可以说这是一个非常神圣的地方，所以请不要使用相机或手机，并脱掉鞋子。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So the word sacred refers to something that is religious and very important for that religion, specifically in this occasion, we're talking about the Hindu religion.
segments.cn: 所以神圣这个词指的是在宗教上非常重要的东西，特别是在这个场合，我们谈论的是印度教。

segments.en: OK, so the Hindu religion or Hinduism is a religion that's widely practiced in the world and maybe most commonly found in India.
segments.cn: 好的，印度教或印度教是世界上广泛实践的宗教，可能在印度最常见。

segments.en: So you'll see a lot of Hindu temples in India and people don't eat beef, like we said, because cows are sacred in the Hindu religion.
segments.cn: 所以你会在印度看到很多印度教寺庙，人们不吃牛肉，正如我们所说，因为牛在印度教中是神圣的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: OK, so now in India or for Indian food, it's common to not use any type of utensil to eat.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在印度或印度食物中，通常不使用任何餐具来吃。

segments.en: OK, so you might be wondering, what is a utensil?
segments.cn: 好的，你可能会想，什么是餐具？

segments.en: I know forks.
segments.cn: 我知道叉子。

segments.en: I know spoons.
segments.cn: 我知道勺子。

segments.en: Well, utensil is the word that describes all forks, spoons and knives, things that you eat with.
segments.cn: 好吧，餐具是描述所有叉子、勺子和刀的词，吃东西的工具。

segments.en: OK, so utensils are tools for eating and it's a very general category.
segments.cn: 好的，所以餐具是吃的工具，是一个非常广泛的类别。

segments.en: Right, exactly.
segments.cn: 对，正是如此。

segments.en: So utensils are spoons, forks, knives, everything.
segments.cn: 所以餐具包括勺子、叉子、刀，所有东西。

segments.en: Chopsticks are utensils even.
segments.cn: 甚至筷子也是餐具。

segments.en: OK, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And now since we don't use any utensils, you usually eat with your hand and you scoop up the food, the rice or the curry.
segments.cn: 现在因为我们不使用任何餐具，通常用手吃饭，舀起食物、米饭或咖喱。

segments.en: OK, to scoop up, this is a verb and usually you use your hands to scoop something.
segments.cn: 好的，舀起，这是一个动词，通常你用手舀东西。

segments.en: So in this case, I can use a piece of bread to scoop up or to pick up some food.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，我可以用一块面包来舀起或捡起一些食物。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So the verb to scoop up, it usually means that you somehow make a little bowl or a little figure with your hand so that the liquid or the food will fit inside, kind of like a little scoop or a little cup.
segments.cn: 所以动词舀起，通常意味着你用手做一个小碗或小形状，以便液体或食物能放进去，就像一个小勺或小杯子。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So to scoop up, scoop something up.
segments.cn: 所以舀起，舀起某样东西。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So now let's go back.
segments.cn: 现在让我们回去。

segments.en: Let's review this dialogue.
segments.cn: 让我们复习一下这个对话。

segments.en: And when we come back, we're going to take a look at the specific Indian dishes found in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 当我们回来时，我们将看看这个对话中提到的具体印度菜肴。

segments.en: So where is this mystery restaurant that we're going to?
segments.cn: 那我们要去的神秘餐厅在哪里？

segments.en: It's an Indian restaurant.
segments.cn: 是一家印度餐厅。

segments.en: I know you have never had Indian food, so I thought you might want to try it.
segments.cn: 我知道你从未吃过印度食物，所以我想你可能想尝试一下。

segments.en: That sounds great.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: I am craving some type of beef dish.
segments.cn: 我想吃某种牛肉菜肴。

segments.en: Well, Indian cuisine actually doesn't serve beef.
segments.cn: 其实，印度菜不提供牛肉。

segments.en: You see, cows are a sacred animal, a very important element in the Hindu religion.
segments.cn: 你看，牛是神圣的动物，在印度教中非常重要。

segments.en: So beef is not eaten.
segments.cn: 所以不吃牛肉。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: So what are we having?
segments.cn: 那我们吃什么？

segments.en: Chicken?
segments.cn: 鸡肉？

segments.en: There are many amazing dishes to choose from.
segments.cn: 有很多美味的菜肴可供选择。

segments.en: We can have some chicken tikka masala, which is an amazing curry.
segments.cn: 我们可以吃一些鸡肉咖喱，这是一道很棒的咖喱。

segments.en: It's a bit spicy, but I think you can handle it.
segments.cn: 有点辣，但我觉得你能接受。

segments.en: Sounds good.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: I've always heard that Indian spices give a rich flavor to food.
segments.cn: 我一直听说印度香料给食物带来丰富的味道。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Also, we can have some naan bread, which is baked in a tandoori oven.
segments.cn: 另外，我们可以吃一些烤饼，这是在坦杜里烤箱中烤制的。

segments.en: Since you don't use any utensils to eat, you can use this bread to scoop up the curry or rice.
segments.cn: 由于你不使用任何餐具来吃饭，你可以用这块面包来舀咖喱或米饭。

segments.en: What about veggies?
segments.cn: 蔬菜呢？

segments.en: Oh, they have a good variety of vegetable based dishes like palak paneer, vegetable samosas or dal.
segments.cn: 哦，他们有很多美味的蔬菜菜肴，比如菠菜奶酪、蔬菜萨莫萨或达尔。

segments.en: It all sounds so exquisite.
segments.cn: 听起来都很美味。

segments.en: I can't wait.
segments.cn: 我等不及了。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at those dishes on Language Takeaway, part two.
segments.cn: 现在让我们来看看语言外卖的第二部分菜肴。

segments.en: Oh, Marco, these lessons are making me so hungry.
segments.cn: 哦，马尔科，这些课程让我好饿。

segments.en: We've been doing them for a couple of weeks now, and this one is no exception.
segments.cn: 我们已经上了几周的课，这一课也不例外。

segments.en: We talked a little bit today about chicken dishes and vegetable dishes, but a very general kind of dish in Indian food is a curry.
segments.cn: 今天我们稍微谈了一下鸡肉菜肴和蔬菜菜肴，但印度菜中一种非常普遍的菜肴是咖喱。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: A curry.
segments.cn: 咖喱。

segments.en: Now, this is a naan and it's a dish that has a variety of spices in it.
segments.cn: 这是一个烤饼，它是一种含有多种香料的菜肴。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So there are many different flavors, not just one flavor.
segments.cn: 所以有很多不同的味道，不止一种味道。

segments.en: You can have chicken curries and vegetable curries and mutton or lamb curries.
segments.cn: 你可以有鸡肉咖喱、蔬菜咖喱和羊肉或羔羊咖喱。

segments.en: But the thing that you need to remember in Indian food is that there's usually different colors of curry, red, yellow or green curries.
segments.cn: 但你需要记住的是，印度菜通常有不同颜色的咖喱，红色、黄色或绿色的咖喱。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So the dishes are usually called curries.
segments.cn: 所以这些菜通常被称为咖喱。

segments.en: And an example of a curry, we have a chicken tikka masala curry.
segments.cn: 咖喱的一个例子是鸡肉提卡马萨拉咖喱。

segments.en: OK, so we know that there's chicken in it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们知道里面有鸡肉。

segments.en: And tikka means that it's grilled chicken.
segments.cn: 而提卡意味着它是烤鸡。

segments.en: And masala is the name of the spice or the curry, the spice that's in that curry.
segments.cn: 马萨拉是香料或咖喱的名称，里面的香料。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So a curry is kind of like a thick sauce with pieces of chicken in it.
segments.cn: 所以咖喱有点像一种浓稠的酱汁，里面有鸡肉块。

segments.en: In this case, for the chicken tikka masala, it's a little bit spicy and it's a color red.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，鸡肉提卡马萨拉有点辣，颜色是红色的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So we've got the chicken tikka masala or masala.
segments.cn: 所以我们有鸡肉提卡马萨拉或马萨拉。

segments.en: And usually you eat this with rice or bread.
segments.cn: 通常你会和米饭或面包一起吃。

segments.en: But in India, there's a special... There are many different kinds of bread, but the special bread we heard today was called naan bread.
segments.cn: 但在印度，有一种特别的……有很多不同种类的面包，但我们今天听到的特别面包叫做烤饼。

segments.en: Right, naan bread.
segments.cn: 对，烤饼。

segments.en: And it's just basically a type of bread.
segments.cn: 它基本上是一种面包。

segments.en: Now, it's not like the bread that you usually have at home.
segments.cn: 现在，它和你在家里通常吃的面包不一样。

segments.en: It's a flat bread.
segments.cn: 它是一种扁平的面包。

segments.en: So it kind of looks like a pancake almost.
segments.cn: 所以它看起来几乎像一个煎饼。

segments.en: It does.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: It's not fluffy.
segments.cn: 它不是蓬松的。

segments.en: It's flat.
segments.cn: 它是扁平的。

segments.en: And the way they cook it is they use this special oven and they cook it inside the oven.
segments.cn: 它的烹饪方式是使用这种特殊的烤箱，在里面烹饪。

segments.en: Now, the question is, what is that oven called, Marco?
segments.cn: 现在，问题是，那个烤箱叫什么，马尔科？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: The oven that we heard is a tandoori oven.
segments.cn: 我们听到的烤箱是坦杜里烤箱。

segments.en: OK, so tandoori is just the name of this oven.
segments.cn: 好的，所以坦杜里只是这个烤箱的名称。

segments.en: It's also a style of cooking in India and is actually one of my favorite kinds of Indian food because you have these many different kinds of grilled meats.
segments.cn: 这也是印度的一种烹饪风格，实际上是我最喜欢的印度菜之一，因为你可以吃到许多不同种类的烤肉。

segments.en: You can have tandoori chicken, tandoori mutton, things like that.
segments.cn: 你可以有坦杜里鸡、坦杜里羊肉，类似的东西。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So a tandoori oven is a type of oven usually made from Clay.
segments.cn: 所以坦杜里烤箱是一种通常用粘土制成的烤箱。

segments.en: That's why it's called tandoori.
segments.cn: 这就是为什么它叫坦杜里。

segments.en: Now, towards the end, we also have some vegetarian options, because as we heard in India, they don't eat beef.
segments.cn: 现在，最后，我们还有一些素食选择，因为正如我们在印度听到的，他们不吃牛肉。

segments.en: And many people are also vegetarians.
segments.cn: 而且很多人也是素食者。

segments.en: They don't eat any type of meat at all.
segments.cn: 他们根本不吃任何类型的肉。

segments.en: So the first vegetable based dish that we heard is a palak paneer.
segments.cn: 所以我们听到的第一个基于蔬菜的菜肴是菠菜奶酪。

segments.en: That's interesting, actually, because paneer is is curd or like a cheese type of cheese type of thing.
segments.cn: 这实际上很有趣，因为奶酪是凝乳或类似于奶酪的东西。

segments.en: So it's it's usually white and comes in rectangles.
segments.cn: 所以它通常是白色的，呈矩形。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: And and paneer, you can have many different flavors of it.
segments.cn: 而且奶酪可以有很多不同的味道。

segments.en: But paneer generally is a kind of a cheese, like a cottage cheese.
segments.cn: 但奶酪通常是一种像农家奶酪的奶酪。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And palak is actually spinach.
segments.cn: 而菠菜实际上是菠菜。

segments.en: So it's a dish that it kind of looks like a thick sauce, green sauce, which is made out of spinach.
segments.cn: 所以这道菜看起来像一种浓稠的绿色酱汁，是用菠菜做的。

segments.en: And within it, it has little pieces of this type of cheese.
segments.cn: 里面有小块这种奶酪。

segments.en: So I love this dish.
segments.cn: 所以我喜欢这道菜。

segments.en: It's very, very delicious.
segments.cn: 它非常美味。

segments.en: We also have vegetable samosas.
segments.cn: 我们还有蔬菜萨莫萨。

segments.en: Now, a samosa, what's that?
segments.cn: 现在，萨莫萨是什么？

segments.en: Now, this is a great dish.
segments.cn: 这是道很棒的菜。

segments.en: This is often used as an appetizer or as a snack.
segments.cn: 这通常用作开胃菜或小吃。

segments.en: You see these on carts or on the street in India.
segments.cn: 你可以在印度的街头或小摊上看到这些。

segments.en: Now, samosas are like pyramids or triangles and inside they have vegetables.
segments.cn: 现在，萨莫萨像金字塔或三角形，里面有蔬菜。

segments.en: OK, so you can have potatoes and peas or lentil.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你可以有土豆和豌豆或小扁豆。

segments.en: No, not lentils.
segments.cn: 不，不是小扁豆。

segments.en: You can have potatoes and peas.
segments.cn: 你可以有土豆和豌豆。

segments.en: And they're a little bit crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.
segments.cn: 它们外面有点脆，里面柔软。

segments.en: And they're very tasty.
segments.cn: 而且它们非常美味。

segments.en: I guess the equivalent would be to... It's something like an egg roll, more or less.
segments.cn: 我想等同于……这有点像蛋卷，差不多。

segments.en: Or like a dumpling.
segments.cn: 或者像饺子。

segments.en: Or like a dumpling because it is deep fried.
segments.cn: 或者像饺子，因为它是油炸的。

segments.en: It's deep fried.
segments.cn: 它是油炸的。

segments.en: And we also have dal.
segments.cn: 我们还有达尔。

segments.en: So this is actually a type of lentil, as you mentioned.
segments.cn: 所以这实际上是一种小扁豆，正如你提到的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So dal is a lentil dish and it can be flavored in different ways.
segments.cn: 所以达尔是一种小扁豆菜肴，可以用不同的方式调味。

segments.en: But basically lentils are these very, very, very, very small, round things.
segments.cn: 但基本上小扁豆是这些非常非常非常小的圆形东西。

segments.en: They're very good for your health.
segments.cn: 它们对你的健康非常有益。

segments.en: And dal is a kind of a soupy lentil dish.
segments.cn: 而达尔是一种汤状的小扁豆菜肴。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So lentil is the category of this type of...
segments.cn: 所以小扁豆是这种类型的……

segments.en: I don't know if it's... It's not a grain.
segments.cn: 我不知道它是否……它不是谷物。

segments.en: It's a legume.
segments.cn: 它是豆类。

segments.en: It's a legume, exactly.
segments.cn: 它是豆类，确切地说。

segments.en: So it may sound a little bit weird, but we'll post some pictures of different types of lentils because it's like saying potatoes.
segments.cn: 所以这听起来可能有点奇怪，但我们会发布一些不同类型小扁豆的图片，因为这就像说土豆。

segments.en: There are many different types of potatoes, sweet potato and all this.
segments.cn: 有很多不同类型的土豆，红薯等等。

segments.en: And the same thing goes with lentil.
segments.cn: 小扁豆也是如此。

segments.en: So we'll post some pictures so you can see what it looks like.
segments.cn: 所以我们会发布一些图片，让你看看它的样子。

segments.en: But now why don't we go back?
segments.cn: 但现在我们为什么不回去呢？

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue again.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍对话。

segments.en: Let's review everything and we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 让我们复习一下所有内容，我们马上回来。

segments.en: So where is this mystery restaurant that we're going to?
segments.cn: 那么我们要去的这个神秘餐厅在哪里？

segments.en: It's an Indian restaurant.
segments.cn: 是一家印度餐厅。

segments.en: I know you have never had Indian food, so I thought you might want to try it.
segments.cn: 我知道你从未吃过印度菜，所以我想你可能想尝试一下。

segments.en: That sounds great.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: I am craving some type of beef dish.
segments.cn: 我想吃某种牛肉菜肴。

segments.en: Well, Indian cuisine actually doesn't serve beef.
segments.cn: 好吧，印度菜实际上不提供牛肉。

segments.en: You see, cows are a sacred animal, a very important element in the Hindu religion.
segments.cn: 你看，牛是神圣的动物，是印度教中非常重要的元素。

segments.en: So beef is not eaten.
segments.cn: 所以不吃牛肉。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: So what are we having?
segments.cn: 那我们吃什么？

segments.en: Chicken?
segments.cn: 鸡肉？

segments.en: There are many amazing dishes to choose from.
segments.cn: 有很多美味的菜可以选择。

segments.en: We can have some chicken chika masala, which is an amazing curry.
segments.cn: 我们可以吃鸡肉咖喱，这是一道很棒的咖喱。

segments.en: It's a bit spicy, but I think you can handle it.
segments.cn: 有点辣，但我觉得你能接受。

segments.en: Sounds good.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: I've always heard that Indian spices give a rich flavor to food.
segments.cn: 我一直听说印度香料给食物增添了丰富的味道。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Also, we can have some naan bread, which is baked in a tandoori oven.
segments.cn: 另外，我们可以吃一些烤饼，是在坦杜里炉中烤的。

segments.en: Since you don't use any utensils to eat, you can use this bread to scoop up the curry or rice.
segments.cn: 由于你不使用餐具，你可以用这个饼来舀咖喱或米饭。

segments.en: What about veggies?
segments.cn: 蔬菜呢？

segments.en: Oh, they have a good variety of vegetable-based dishes like palak paneer, vegetable samosas, or dal.
segments.cn: 哦，他们有很多基于蔬菜的菜肴，比如菠菜奶酪、蔬菜萨莫萨或达尔。

segments.en: It all sounds so exquisite.
segments.cn: 听起来都很精致。

segments.en: I can't wait.
segments.cn: 我等不及了。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So Indian food has a reputation of being spicy, but it's very, very delicious.
segments.cn: 印度菜以辣闻名，但非常美味。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And you know, what people always tell me, at least my Indian friends always tell me, is that Indian food... saying Indian food is like saying Chinese food.
segments.cn: 你知道，人们总是告诉我，至少我的印度朋友总是告诉我，印度菜...说印度菜就像说中国菜。

segments.en: We have some general idea, but every different part of India has its own special foods.
segments.cn: 我们有一些大致的了解，但印度的每个不同地区都有自己独特的食物。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And so what we get in America at Indian restaurants might not be the same as what we get at Indian restaurants in India.
segments.cn: 所以我们在美国的印度餐厅吃到的可能和在印度的印度餐厅不一样。

segments.en: So I just want to say that.
segments.cn: 我只是想说这一点。

segments.en: But generally, you can find these dishes at any Indian restaurant in America.
segments.cn: 但一般来说，你可以在美国的任何印度餐厅找到这些菜。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Actually, if next time you're in an Indian restaurant or if you ever go, ask them from what region or what area of India the food is from.
segments.cn: 其实，下次你在印度餐厅时，或者如果你去的话，问他们这些食物来自印度的哪个地区。

segments.en: Because it may be Northern Indian cuisine, and obviously that is going to be a little bit different than maybe the Southern.
segments.cn: 因为可能是北印度菜，显然这和南印度的会有些不同。

segments.en: I think the Southern is supposed to be spicy.
segments.cn: 我觉得南印度的应该是辣的。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And it's just like in every country, even in our own home countries, maybe the food from the coast or from the North will be different from the South or the Inlands.
segments.cn: 就像在每个国家，甚至在我们自己的国家，沿海或北方的食物可能和南方或内陆的不同。

segments.en: And I just want to make one more comment.
segments.cn: 我还想再说一点。

segments.en: One of my favorite things to do that many Indian restaurants offer in America is the lunch buffet.
segments.cn: 我最喜欢的事情之一是许多美国的印度餐厅提供的午餐自助餐。

segments.en: So a buffet is basically a self-serve of food.
segments.cn: 自助餐基本上是自助取食。

segments.en: So the restaurant will put out many different dishes and you can take as much as you want of each, but you pay one price.
segments.cn: 餐厅会提供许多不同的菜肴，你可以根据自己的喜好取，但只需支付一个价格。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So it's $11.99 or something.
segments.cn: 所以大约是11.99美元。

segments.en: That's very, very good.
segments.cn: 这非常好。

segments.en: And yeah, so I often do this when I'm home in the States and I just, you know, I get to pick my favorite dishes and I eat as much as I want.
segments.cn: 是的，所以我在美国时经常这样做，我可以选择我最喜欢的菜，吃多少都可以。

segments.en: And actually I think one other thing that's worth mentioning, we didn't mention in the dialogue, but the Indian sweets and the tea is very, very good.
segments.cn: 其实还有一件值得一提的事，我们在对话中没有提到，印度的甜点和茶非常好。

segments.en: The milk tea that they drink in India is delicious and the sweets are very, very good.
segments.cn: 他们在印度喝的奶茶很好喝，甜点也非常好。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: They're famous for being very good and not very healthy for you.
segments.cn: 他们以非常好而不健康而闻名。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，确实如此。

segments.en: They're very sweet.
segments.cn: 他们非常甜。

segments.en: If you're in an Indian restaurant, take note, look for these different things and let us know, do you like to eat Indian food?
segments.cn: 如果你在印度餐厅，注意看看这些不同的东西，告诉我们，你喜欢吃印度菜吗？

segments.en: If so, what's your favorite dish?
segments.cn: 如果喜欢，你最喜欢的菜是什么？

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So we'll see you guys at our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以我们在网站上见，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: And until next time.
segments.cn: 下次见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
